alert.note: Alert for Northwest Blue Mountains (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 18 at 12:53PM PST until December 19 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST MONDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM PST TUESDAY THROUGH 10 AM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to 5 to 9 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 12 inches possible. * WHERE...In Oregon, Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon. In Washington, Northwest Blue Mountains. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 10 AM PST Monday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from 4 AM PST Tuesday until 10 AM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. I-84 and SR-204 will be impacted by snow.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1, or by visiting online at https://tripcheck.com for Oregon or https://wsdot.com/travel for Washington.
